card_list.title: Flex your toes for 5 seconds. Flex your toes for 5 seconds.
card_list.subtitle: Where do you feel some tension when you do that? Where do you feel some tension when you do that?

card_list.title: Try to wiggle each toe individually.
card_list.subtitle: Which one was easiest to wiggle?

card_list.title: Rotate each ankles in both directions.
card_list.hint: Pay attention to how it feels and sounds.
card_list.subtitle: Did your ankles make any noises?

card_list.title: Flex both feet and hold for 5 seconds.
card_list.subtitle: Do you feel muscles relaxing in the following areas?

card_list.title: Stand up and touch your toes for 5 seconds.
card_list.hint: This stretch helps increase blood circulation if you’ve been sitting for a while.
card_list.subtitle: Did your stretch deepen during those 5 seconds?

card_list.title: Tense or flex your calf muscles. Hold for 5 seconds, then release.
card_list.subtitle: Do you feel any tingling in your calves or knees afterwards?

card_list.title: Squeeze your calves and give them a little massage.
card_list.subtitle: What's a sensation you notice in your calves now?

card_list.title: Feel yourself pressed into the surface of where you are.
card_list.hint: Sitting, standing, lying down, anything is okay, unless you’re levitating.
card_list.subtitle: What's the first thing you notice?

card_list.title: Twist left and right from the waist 3 times.
card_list.subtitle: Did your body make any noises when you did that?

card_list.title: Clasp your left wrist with your right hand and lean to the right for 5 seconds.
card_list.hint: Do both sides. Standing up is optional
card_list.subtitle: Did you feel a good stretch in your sides?

card_list.title: Suck in your stomach and hold for 3 seconds. Then completely relax.
card_list.hint: It's okay to slouch here. :)
card_list.subtitle: What's the first thing you notice?

card_list.title: Roll you shoulders backwards 5 times and forwards 5 times
card_list.subtitle: What noises or vibrations came from your shoulders?

card_list.title: Raise your shoulders up. Hold for 5 seconds. Then plop them down.
card_list.subtitle: What sounds the most appealing right now?

options.text: moving on to the next question

card_list.title: Give yourself a well deserved shoulder massage.
Drop your head down and let it fall forward.
card_list.subtitle: What's something you notice in your neck?
placeholder_texts: ex: tension in the left side

card_list.title: Roll your head twice clockwise, then twice counter-clockwise.
card_list.subtitle: Did you feel your neck pop?

card_list.title: Make this expression
card_list.hint: (and then relax your face)
card_list.subtitle: Does your face feel any different?

card_list.title: Massage the bridge of your nose while counting to 5.
card_list.subtitle: What's a sensation you notice afterwards?

card_list.title: Massage your temple while counting to 5.
card_list.subtitle: Do you feel any lingering sensations afterwards?

card_list.title: Imagine these are your feet.
What's the first word that comes to mind about the last screen?
Breathe out through your mouth.
card_list.subtitle: What sensations, if any, do you feel in your throat?

card_list.title: Put your hand on your heart
card_list.subtitle: and wait until you can sense a rhythm consistently.

card_list.title: Thank you heart!
card_list.subtitle: No matter what's going on in your life, your heart is working hard for you. Give it a big mental hug.

card_list.title: Freeze!
card_list.subtitle: What position is your shoulder in right now?

options.text: one side is higher than the other

card_list.title: What expression is your face in currently?
Swing your lower legs back and forth (at the knee joint).
card_list.subtitle: Do you feel any sensations in your knees?

card_list.title: Flex your calves for 10 seconds.
card_list.subtitle: Do you feel any sensations in your calves?

card_list.title: Hold a squat while counting to 5.
card_list.subtitle: Do you feel any sensations in your thighs?

card_list.title: Press firmly into a chair.
card_list.hint: Sit down (or up) if you're not already sitting.
card_list.subtitle: Do you feel any sensations in your butt?

card_list.title: Flex your core muscles!
card_list.subtitle: Do you feel any sensations in your core?

card_list.title: Stretch your arms out behind you.
card_list.subtitle: Do you feel any sensations in your upper chest?

card_list.title: Look to the left and right.
card_list.subtitle: Do you feel any sensations in your neck?

card_list.title: Straighten out your posture!
card_list.subtitle: Do you feel any sensations in your lower back?

card_list.title: Wiggle your shoulders.
card_list.subtitle: Do you feel any sensations in your upper back?

card_list.title: Notice how the light falls in the room.
card_list.subtitle: Does it come from multiple sources?

card_list.title: Find one shadow you can see.
card_list.subtitle: Is it sharp or blurry?

card_list.title: Find one place where the light reflects off an object.
card_list.subtitle: Is it a sharp glint or a soft glimmer?

card_list.title: Take a look at an object that seems very common.
card_list.hint: Something you see all the time.
card_list.subtitle: List all the colors you see.

card_list.title: Find something nearby that you don't like.
card_list.hint: Try not to think about it too hard.
card_list.subtitle: What's one detail you can observe about it neutrally?

card_list.title: Find one thing that's this color.
card_list.hint: It's okay if it's multiple colors, as long as it has this color in it.
card_list.subtitle: What is it?

card_list.hint: It's okay if it's multiple colors, as long as it has this color in it.

card_list.title: Find 3 things that have a smooth surface.
card_list.subtitle: What are they?

card_list.title: Look again carefully.
card_list.subtitle: Are they all equally smooth?

card_list.title: Find 3 things that look soft to touch.
card_list.subtitle: What are they?

card_list.title: Pick a fabric in the room.
card_list.hint: Could be curtains, carpet, even your clothes!
card_list.subtitle: If you get close, can you see individual fibers?

card_list.title: What's one detail you noticed about this fabric?
card_list.hint: Could be something you see, touch, or even smell!

card_list.title: Remember learning about shapes in kindergarten?
card_list.hint: Those were the good days!
card_list.subtitle: Can you find a perfect circle in your surroundings? What is it?

card_list.title: Remember learning about shapes in kindergarten?
card_list.hint: Those were the good days!
card_list.subtitle: Can you find a triangle in your surroundings? What is it?

card_list.title: Remember learning about shapes in kindergarten?
card_list.hint: Those were the good days!
card_list.subtitle: Can you find a perfect square in your surroundings? What is it?

card_list.title: How much movement is there around you?
Can you find a bit of nature to look at?
card_list.hint: Even if it's just one blade of grass!
card_list.subtitle: What did you see?

card_list.title: Listen to your surroundings.
card_list.hint: Even if it's quiet, you'll be surprised what you might hear when you take a moment to listen.
card_list.subtitle: What's one thing that you were surprised to hear?

card_list.title: Pick up an item nearby and make a little noise with it.
card_list.hint: Focus on the physical experience, the vibrations and the sound.
card_list.subtitle: What did you choose to do?

card_list.title: Say the name of someone (or something) you love out loud.
card_list.hint: Notice how your lips and tongue feel when you do it.
card_list.subtitle: Did you smile?

card_list.title: Rub your palms together while counting to 10.
card_list.hint: Focus on the warmth and texture.
card_list.subtitle: What's the first word that comes to mind?

card_list.title: Find something soft to touch.
card_list.subtitle: What did you choose?

card_list.title: Choose an object to feel and describe one detail.
What is the temperature of the room?
Pick up something within reach.
card_list.subtitle: What temperature is it?

card_list.title: Name one thing you can taste.
card_list.hint: Could be some food or drink nearby, or just the lingering taste of something on your tongue.

card_list.title: We often don't smell things.
card_list.hint: Unless it's perfume or to check if it's gone bad!
card_list.subtitle: Can you pick out any scents in the air?

card_list.title: Pick an object nearby.
card_list.subtitle: What does it smell like?
While our noses aren't as sensitive as those of animals, it's an entire dimension of experience that we often aren't aware of!

card_list.title: Take a deep breath and hold it (while swiping to the next screen)!
Blow those bubbles!
Take a deep breath and hold it (while swiping to the next screen)!
Blow that dandelion!
Pretend you're blowing those bubbles
Try to blow out this candle!
card_list.hint: Hint: it might be impossible, so move on after you give it your best shot!

card_list.title: Blow out this match!
Try to match one breath to the rhythm of the waves
Take a deep breath and hold it (while swiping to the next screen)!
Blow that glitter!
Make a wish!
Can you blow these candles out?
Take a deep breath and hold it (while swiping to the next screen)!
Blow this powder everywhere!
card_list.hint: No cleanup necessary!

card_list.title: We’ll start by becoming aware of our physical surroundings.
card_list.subtitle:
This can feel mundane if there isn’t anything special to notice, but this isn’t about looking at anything in particular. 

This is about refocusing attention on details of the present moment.

card_list.title: First, a quick check-in with our surroundings.
card_list.subtitle: The act of intentionally noticing even basic details about the physical world helps mindfulness become second nature over time.

card_list.title: First, turn your awareness to the physical space around you.
card_list.subtitle:
It’s okay if you’re in the same place every day and there’s not much to see. 

This is about practicing being aware so that mindfulness becomes second nature.

card_list.title: To start off, a quick check-in with the physical world around you.
card_list.subtitle: There are no wrong answers. This is about the act of noticing, not what you notice.

card_list.title: Great job!
card_list.subtitle:
Slowing down to notice even one small detail about your surroundings can ground you in the present moment.

Now for a quick “breather” before the next section.

card_list.title: Nice!
card_list.subtitle: Now we’ll do a quick visual-based breathing exercise.

card_list.title: Awesome!
card_list.subtitle:
Next up: deep breathing. 

Deep breathing has been proven to activate the para-sympathetic nervous system, helping you feel calm and relaxed.

card_list.title: Now for some body awareness.
card_list.subtitle: Over time you’ll notice this awareness becoming second nature as you go about your day.

card_list.title: Now for a check-in with your body.
card_list.subtitle: Focusing on your physical experience helps calm the mind.

card_list.title: For the next section, turn your attention inward to your body.
card_list.subtitle: Think of it as a quick reset from the thoughts typically running through our heads.

card_list.title: This next section is about your physical experience of your body.
card_list.subtitle: We’re often not even aware of discomfort in the body that’s easily remedied.

card_list.title: Great job checking in with your body!
card_list.subtitle: Last up, a little relaxation before going back to your life.

card_list.title: Congratulations!
card_list.subtitle: In just a few moments you’ve become more aware of your physical experience and surroundings.

card_list.title: Congratulations!
card_list.subtitle:
You were awesome!

Every boost is different so come back next time for a new set of questions!

Finally, take 3 deep breaths and watch the rain drops.
Finally, take 3 deep breaths and enjoy the waves.
Finally, take 3 deep breaths as you travel over these trees.
Finally, take 3 deep breaths while following this icy river.
Finally, take 3 deep breaths as you watch the rain drops.
Finally, take 3 deep breaths as you watch the droplets.
Pick a place to focus on.
Take a focused look at that place.
card_list.subtitle: What's one thing you noticed?

card_list.title: Take a moment
card_list.subtitle: to turn on “do not disturb” mode, get comfortable, and take a deep breath.

card_list.title: Good job!
card_list.subtitle: Did you know? We don’t record your responses, so you can feel comfortable writing whatever.

card_list.title: Fantastic!
card_list.subtitle: Awesome job! Did you know? You can always swipe to skip a question to get a new one!
